results.title: Levantes
results.creator_credit: Fionn Skiotis, Lisa Horler and Kalokairi Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘Levantes’ (translation from the Greek: East Wind) is a personal essay combining documentary images with a fictional narration. It tells the story of a young Greek Australian man travelling through Greece and Turkey, crossing the border to avoid army service. His impressions and reflections on the legacy of the region are told in an intimate monologue that he addresses to a friend back home in Australia. He talks about Greece, the journey, himself and his friend and the two nations, Greece and Turkey, which are as close as they are wide apart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fionn Skiotis, Lisa Horler and Kalokairi Pictures

results.title: Let your child help you
results.brief_description: This film shows how very young children may help in the every-day household chores, thus developing a sense of accomplishment and responsibility while they increase their skill and co-ordination.

results.title: Let's make a film
results.brief_description: Explores the activities of the Yellow Ball Workshop, Newton, Massachusetts, which involves young people from the ages of eight through to eighteen who create their own animated films. Individual students demonstrate and discuss the steps involved in preparing their film and show the finished product.

results.title: Let's look at radio: glimpses of programmes and personalities in the radio world
results.creator_credit: James Pearson and Australian Federation of Commercial Broadcasting Stations
results.brief_description: Gives glimpses of many of the best known radio entertainers in Australia and of popular programs being rehearsed and broadcast. The film emphasises that commercial broadcasting stations provide an entertainment service that is popular with the person in the street. it also shows how they provide the community with other services such as flood and fire warnings in country districts, police messages etc. Commentary: Jack Davey

results.title: Let's look at New Zealand
results.brief_description: The history, geography, customs and cities of New Zealand, and the economic and cultural development of its people. Includes houses and battlements of ancient warlike Maori tribes; cities of today; geological wonders including geysers and hot mud pools; agricultural wealth; leading national exports; and life of a typical Maori family.

results.title: Let's go sailing. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Two people learn the elements of dinghy sailing and seamanship with expert instructors at a sailing school. The first lessons are given in Albacore, a National Firefly and a National Enterprise. When the rudiments have been learned they progress to an Ocean Racer.

results.title: Let's go riding
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: The progress story of a father and daughter whose visit to a riding school decides them to take up riding. As a result of further training at a pony club and a riding club they reach a sufficient standard to consider specialising in dressage, show jumping and cross country. The film also contains examples of top grade riding at national and international events.

results.title: Let's go gliding
results.brief_description: For centuries mankind has admired the soaring eagle and the effortless flight of the gull. While some aeronautical engineers perfect jumbo-jets and space probes, others continue to improve gliders for the sport of soaring. There is no cheaper form of flying. The fuel is solar energy, the motive forces are the thermal air currents triggered by the sun’s rays. Call it sport, or just plain enjoyment, it is an emulation of the bird. This is a celebration of soaring from the viewpoint of real people who are involved in the sport. Narrated by Ian Roache.
